flawed_nl_solution:
Without the discount, each pair cost $10 so 3 pairs cost 3*$10 = $<<10*3=30>>30
With a discount of 10% on the total cost, she can pay only $30-($30*(10/100)) = $<<30-(30*(10/100))=72>>72
By buying 3 at once in order to get the discount, she can save $30-$72 = $-42

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 27, not 72. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
